options.text: Because the number is misleading

title: How do blood transfusions work? - Bill Schutt

multiple-choice.question: **Knowledge**

options.label: A
options.text: Jean-Baptiste Denis performed the first human blood transfusion in 1667.

options.label: B
options.text: William Halsted performed the first successful blood transfusion in 1881.

options.label: C
options.text: Karl Landsteiner discovered blood types in 1901.

options.label: D
options.text: Sodium citrate was used as an anticoagulant in 1914.

multiple-choice.question: **Comprehension**

options.label: A
options.text: The first human blood transfusion was performed by Jean-Baptiste Denis, who transfused sheep's blood into a human.

options.label: B
options.text: Blood transfusions were successful in ancient times due to the discovery of blood types.

options.label: C
options.text: Blood types were discovered by William Halsted in 1881.

options.label: D
options.text: Sodium citrate was used as an anticoagulant to store blood for later use.

multiple-choice.question: **Application**

options.label: A
options.text: A doctor should always transfuse blood from a donor with the same blood type as the recipient to avoid an adverse reaction.

options.label: B
options.text: A nurse should use sodium citrate to store blood for later use.

options.label: C
options.text: A medic should use a portable machine to transport donor blood onto the battlefield.

options.label: D
options.text: A researcher should experiment with transfusing blood from different species.

multiple-choice.question: **Analysis**

options.label: A
options.text: The discovery of blood types led to the success of human-to-human blood transfusions.

options.label: B
options.text: The use of sodium citrate as an anticoagulant allowed for the storage of blood for later use.

options.label: C
options.text: The development of portable machines enabled the transportation of donor blood onto the battlefield.

options.label: D
options.text: The discovery of heparin as an anticoagulant replaced the use of sodium citrate.

multiple-choice.question: **Synthesis**

options.label: A
options.text: The discovery of blood types and the development of anticoagulants have made blood transfusions a safe and effective medical treatment.

options.label: B
options.text: The use of portable machines and anticoagulants has enabled the transportation of donor blood onto the battlefield.

options.label: C
options.text: The discovery of heparin has replaced the use of sodium citrate as an anticoagulant.

options.label: D
options.text: The development of modern blood banks has made it possible to store and transport large amounts of blood.

multiple-choice.question: **Evaluation**

options.label: A
options.text: The discovery of blood types was a crucial step in the success of human-to-human blood transfusions.

options.label: B
options.text: The use of sodium citrate as an anticoagulant was a significant improvement over previous methods.

options.label: C
